statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Rider 65, Fairfield 62
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. -- Novar Gadson scored 19 points, and made 8 of 9 from the free-throw line to lead Rider over Fairfield 65-62 Sunday. The Broncs (13-18, 10-8 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) made 20 of 28 foul shots, while Fairfield struggled, connecting on 46.2 percent (6 of 13) from the line. Rider led by as many as 13 midway through the second half before Fairfield used a 15-2 run to make it close. Rakim Sanders' layup pulled the Stags (17-13, 12-6) within one, 63-62, with 1:15 to go. However, Maurice Barrow missed both his free throws for Fairfield with 46 seconds left, and Gadson scored on a layup 18 seconds later for the final margin. Sanders missed two 3-pointers in the final 12 seconds. Daniel Stewart added 14 points and Jonathon Thompson 13 for the Broncs. Fairfield was led by Ryan Olander with 17 points and Barrow with 15 points and 16 rebounds.
